definitions: To take (another person's property) without permission or legal right and without intending to return it.
To move somewhere quietly or surreptitiously.
To get or achieve something surreptitiously or by a trick.
To take the opportunity to do something quickly or surreptitiously.
examples: He tried to steal a car.
She stole quietly out of the room.
The team stole a victory in the last minute.
I'll steal a few minutes to call you.
